insult noun [C]
(INJURY)
medical
  specialized something that causes an injury or damage to the body: Her cerebral cortex had suffered a massive insult. The virus can cause repeated pulmonary insults.
More examplesFewer examplesA membrane insult is sustained that renders the sperm incapable of its normal functions.Children who are separated from their mothers suffer what one doctor calls "a developmental insult".
